question: Liquefactive necrosis is a feature of?
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., Brain Liquefactive necrosiso It is the necrotic degradation of tissue that rapidly undergo softening and liquefaction because of the action of hydrolytic enzymes. The primary pathogenic mechanism is enzymatic digestion of cell. Liquefactive necrosis occurs after1) Infection i. e., suppurative inflammation (most common); and2) Ischemic necrosis of brain.
topic_name: Morphology of Cell and Tissue Injury

question: Fat necrosis occurs in -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Omentum o Repeat from previous sessions.
topic_name: Morphology of Cell and Tissue Injury

question: Formation of granulation tissue is due to:
exp: Ans. is 'b' Budding of new capillaries Granulation tissue is a highly vascularized connective tissue. It is formed when tissue heals by scar formation. It appears pink and granular because of newly formed capillaries present in it. It also consists of: Fibroblasts. Residual inflammatory cells.
topic_name: Morphology of Cell and Tissue Injury
